response:
The presence of fever (38.1°C) combined with subacute brainstem signs in a young patient strongly suggests an infectious or inflammatory aetiology. Rhombencephalitis (particularly Listeria or viral) is a top concern. A brainstem abscess (possibly parasitic given the history of Roundworm) or high-grade glioma are important differentials. Demyelinating disorders like ADEM or MS are also possible.

differential_diagnosis = ["Rhombencephalitis (e.g., Listeria monocytogenes, HSV, Enterovirus)", "Brainstem Abscess (Bacterial or Parasitic)", "Acute Disseminated Encephalomyelitis (ADEM)", "Brainstem Glioma", "Multiple Sclerosis", "Vertebral Artery Dissection"]
